title: Honoring the retirement of Michael J. Grogan, Senior Chief Seabee Combat Warfare Specialist, United States Navy
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  the  retirement of Michael J. Grogan,
Senior Chief Seabee Combat Warfare Specialist, United States Navy

WHEREAS, Individuals who dedicate their lives to military service  merit
the  commendation  and  applause of all citizens for their commitment to
the preservation of American freedom; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to honor the
retirement of Michael J. Grogan,  Senior  Chief  Seabee  Combat  Warfare
Specialist, United States Navy; and
  WHEREAS,  Michael J. Grogan was born in Albany, New York; he graduated
from Colonie Central High School in 1980 and  ten  days  later,  he  was
attending  Boot  Camp  in  San Antonio, Texas with the United States Air
Force; while on active duty, he spent ten years  stationed  at  Griffiss
Air Force Base (AFB), Rome, New York; and
  WHEREAS,  During his tour at Griffiss AFB, Michael Grogan was assigned
to the 416 Organizational Maintenance Squadron (OMS) to maintain B-52's;
during his tenure at Griffiss, he was  selected  in  1985  to  represent
Griffiss  AFB,  as  their  Crew  Chief  to  compete in the Strategic Air
Command (SAC) Weapons Load Competition;  in  1990  after  ten  years  of
active duty service in the United States Air Force, he decided to pursue
a civilian career; and
  WHEREAS, In 1994, after missing the comraderie of the military, Micha-
el  Grogan  became  affiliated with the United States Navy Reserves as a
Seabee; he was assigned to Naval Mobile  Construction  Battalion  (NMCB)
13,  Detachment  13  of  Frankfort,  New  York, which was decommissioned
shortly after his assignment;  he  was  then  assigned  to  Construction
Battalion Maintenance Unit (CBMU) 202 in Groton, Connecticut; and
  WHEREAS,  In  2000,  while  assigned  to  CBMU 202, Michael Grogan was
promoted to the rank of Chief Petty Officer; after his promotion, he was
assigned as the Officer in Charge (OIC) of a detachment  of  Seabees  in
Newport,  Rhode Island; in 2001 he was mobilized with the New York Naval
Militia in support of World Trade Center Attack; and
  WHEREAS, In 2004, the Naval Construction Force had a force realignment
which combined all CBMU 202 personnel to now be reassigned to  NMCB  27;
while assigned to NMCB 27, Michael Grogan maintained his position as OIC
at  Newport,  Rhode  Island;  in  2005, he was mobilized with NMCB 5, an
active duty battalion in support of Operation Iraqi Freedom; and
  WHEREAS, While in  Iraq,  Michael  Grogan  earned  his  Seabee  Combat
Warfare  Specialist  title  and  was  awarded the U.S. Army Commendation
Medal for his duties while supporting the U.S. Army  Special  Operations
Force;  upon  his return in 2006, he was promoted to his current rank of
Senior  Chief  Petty  Officer  and  was  reassigned  to  the  7th  Naval
Construction  Regiment, Newport, Rhode Island, as the Current Operations
Chief; and
  WHEREAS, Senior Chief Grogan is  a  qualified  Seabee  Combat  Warfare
Specialist,  Senior  Aircraft  Maintenance  Specialist,  and Master Crew
Chief; he also holds the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA)  Airframe
and Powerplant License and his personal awards include: the Navy Commen-
dation Medal, Army Commendation Medal, Air Force Commendation Medal, the
Navy  and  Marine  Corps  Achievement Medal, along with various unit and
campaign awards; and
  WHEREAS, As a civilian, Michael Grogan is employed  at  Revere  Copper
Products,  Inc.;  he  is a Maintenance Planner/Scheduler and supervisor;
and

  WHEREAS, A resident of Lee, New York, Michael Grogan  was  married  to
the  late Brenda M. Grogan of Rome; he has three children, Jacqui, Whit-
ney, and Michael, as well as three grandchildren; and
  WHEREAS,  Rare indeed is the occurrence of such a compassionate blend-
ing of strength, leadership, intellect, and commitment  as  that  demon-
strated  by  over a lifetime of sacrifice and dedication to others; now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor  the  retirement  of Michael J. Grogan, Senior Chief Seabee Combat
Warfare Specialist, United States Navy; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to  Michael  J.  Grogan,  Senior  Chief  Seabee  Combat  Warfare
Specialist, United States Navy.
